sent
to þe bi&slong;chope of þe lond &punctelev; fur&slong;t he &slong;chal him &slong;chriue

And &slong;egge þat manie þudere wendeth &punctelev; and aȝein þare comieth fewe

¶Þe p&rrot;io&rrot; him wole al&slong;o rede inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot;to chaungi is þouȝt
And ȝwane he &slong;iȝkz him &slong;tudefa&slong;t &punctelev; þat he nele bileue it nouȝt

him&slong;ulf he &slong;chal him ble&slong;&slong;i al&slong;o &punctelev; and þanne into þe putte gon·

Amo&rrot;uwe In in þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; heo &slong;hullen come þudere eft&slong;one

&slong;teuene Stevene &punctelev; þat novþe late wa&slong;

Þe kniȝt &slong;at with careful heo&rrot;te &punctelev; he &slong;iȝte and weop ful so&rrot;e
¶Sire &slong;eide þe kniȝt ȝwan ich habbe &punctelev; manne wo&rrot;&slong;t ido

Ichulle me take to gode&slong; Godes grace &punctelev; and in is name iwende

paterike&slong; Paterikes
purgato&rrot;ie Purgatorie &punctelev; and take þat god God me wole &slong;ende
Ov beu frere quath þe bi&slong;chop &punctelev; be &slong;tille ȝwi &long;ei&slong;tþov &slong;o

¶ Þe bi&slong;chop p&rrot;echede him fa&slong;te inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot;to chaungi is þouȝt

To þe p&rrot;io&rrot; of þe &slong;tude &punctelev; his lettres made sone
Þat he scholde bi him do &punctelev; ase bi swuch a man was to done
¶ Þe p&rrot;io&rrot; p&rrot;echede him fa&slong;te inovȝ &punctelev; and schewede him resones inowe
&YOGH;if he miȝte changi is þouȝt &punctelev; þat he him withd&rrot;owe
bote is p&rrot;echinge was al fo&rrot; nouȝt. &punctelev; ase he saiȝ atþen ende
Þat he nolde lete fo&rrot; noþing &punctelev; þene perilouse wei to wende
Þe p&rrot;io&rrot; nam him bi þe hond &punctelev; and into churche him b&rrot;ouȝte
Þare he ful akne adoun &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerdes grace bisouȝte
In fa&slong;tingues and in o&rrot;esones &punctelev; fourtene niȝt he lai
Fo&rrot;te bidde o&rrot;e louerdes grace. &punctelev; and in þe fourteþe dai
Þat Couent cam aboute him &punctelev; and oþere p&rrot;eo&slong;tes also
And clerkes, with p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; þe seruise fo&rrot; him to do
¶ Fo&rrot; him heo songun þe heiȝemasse &punctelev; and to o&rrot;e louerd criden fa&slong;te
And o&rrot;e louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; heo ȝeuen him atþe la&slong;te

Þe p&rrot;io&rrot; onlek þe puttes do&rrot;e &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e heom echon

Fewe here comen euere aȝen &punctelev; þat wenden hereIn bifo&rrot;e
Ake heo beoth fo&rrot; to&rrot;mentingue and fo&rrot; wo &punctelev; lif and soule fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath þis kniȝt &punctelev; "rede ȝwat þov me rede
In o&rrot;e louerdes name þane wei ich take &punctelev; to bete mine misdede
Ake fo&rrot; is loue þat us deo&rrot;e bouȝte &punctelev; biddez fo&rrot; me echon
Lif and soule god ich bitake &punctelev; and In his name ichulle In gon."
he blessede him, and wende fo&rrot;th In &punctelev; and bitok god is flesch and is bon
Þe p&rrot;io&rrot; sp&rrot;einde him with holi water &punctelev; and lek þe do&rrot;e anon
Þis guode kniȝt wende him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; wel baldeliche and fa&slong;te
In one holewe weie onder eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; and to god is heo&rrot;te ca&slong;te
Sw&ydot;þe deo&rrot;k it was, þat he ne sa&ydot; riȝt nouȝt &punctelev; ne noþing him ne aga&slong;te
So longe þat him þouȝte he isaiȝ &punctelev; wel feo&rrot; liȝt atþe la&slong;te
Þuderward he wende baldeliche &punctelev; so þat he cam þere neiȝ
Þe faire&slong;te feld þat miȝte beo &punctelev; atþe weiȝes ende he iseiȝ.[Pulchra via.]
¶ ÞareInne he wende murie inovȝ &punctelev; and amidde þe felde he fond
Þe faire&slong;te halle and þe noble&slong;te &punctelev; þat miȝte beo in ani lond
Ake þet weder nas nouȝt cler &punctelev; bote ase it were neiȝ eue
Fo&rrot;to biholde þat noble weo&rrot;k &punctelev; ane &slong;tounde he gan bileue
Þe walles neren nouȝt ihole &punctelev; ake al aboute iwis

Twelf men in ȝwite cloþes &punctelev; swiþe faire and hende

¶ Þo seide on of heom, ase þei it þe p&rrot;io&rrot; were &punctelev; wel mildeliche and &slong;tille
"bev frere, ihered beo Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat on þe b&rrot;ouȝte swuche wille

leue b&rrot;oþur, ȝwane þou wolde&slong;t þis wei &punctelev; fo&rrot; þine sunnes wende
Oþur þov mo&slong;t beon &slong;tudefa&slong;t and hardi &punctelev; and in none manere tu&ydot;rne þi þouȝt
Oþur þov wo&rrot;&slong;t fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e, lif and soule &punctelev; and sone to þe deuel ib&rrot;ouȝt
Fo&rrot; alsosone ase we beth heonne iwent &punctelev; þe feondes luþere and wicke
heo wollez come aboute þe &punctelev; Into þis hous ful þicke

And heo wollez also bihote þe Io&ydot;e inovȝ &punctelev; ȝif þov wolt leue heo&rrot;e lo&rrot;e
And ȝif heo mouwen þo&rrot;uȝ ani bihe&slong;te &punctelev; oþur enie gile, þe ouercome
Fo&rrot;soþe þov wo&rrot;&slong;t, lif and soule &punctelev; adeuele wei al clene inome
Ake ȝif þov art &slong;tudefa&slong;t of heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and on Ihesu cri&slong;t wolt þenche
Ne fo&rrot; bihe&slong;te[MS. he&slong;te he&slong;te] ne fo&rrot; wo &punctelev; fram him þou nelle blenche
Þou wo&rrot;&slong;t quit of alle þine sunnes &punctelev; þat þov ha&slong;t euere iwrouȝt
And þov schalt iseo alle þe Ioies &punctelev; þat guode men beoth inne ib&rrot;ouȝt

Ake in ȝwat wo þat þov euere art &punctelev; euere þench on god, ich rede
¶ And euere ȝwane heo to&rrot;mentiez þe &punctelev; cri Iesu milce and o&rrot;e
And, ȝif þou art &slong;tudefa&slong;t in gode bileue &punctelev; heo ne schullen defouli þe nonmo&rrot;e
We bitakez þe god of heuene &punctelev; and ich rede þov do bi ovre lo&rrot;e."
Þo nu&slong;te þe kniȝt ȝware heo bicomen. &punctelev; he sat and siȝte so&rrot;e
Elinge he bilefte alone &punctelev; and cride on godes miȝte
And Armede him with holie beden &punctelev; aȝen þe deuelene to fiȝte
On þe holi go&slong;t he cride fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him faile
he lokede euere ȝwane heo comen &punctelev; him fo&rrot;to asaille
Ase he sat agodes name &punctelev; þe bataille fo&rrot;to abide
Þare cam a so&rrot;i reuful cri &punctelev; aboute in eche side
Ase alþe wo&rrot;ld tobo&rrot;&slong;te and tob&rrot;eke &punctelev; him þouȝte it was also
Þat, þei alle þe be&slong;tes of þe wo&rrot;lde &punctelev; togadere weren ido
Ase[al. & ase] loude and ase grisliche ase heo miȝten &punctelev; ȝeollinde echone heo were

Þat[al. þat ȝif] is hope and is heo&rrot;te on ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; eueremo&rrot;e heo were,[r. nere]
Elles he hadde wod bicome &punctelev; and ilo&rrot;e is wit fo&rrot; fere
¶ Þo comen heo abouten him &punctelev; þicke and grisliche þere
&YOGH;eonijnde and grenninde on him &punctelev; with ful lodlich chere
"bel ami," quath þe on of heom &punctelev; "þou ha&slong;t ariȝt ido
We owez wel alle anouri þe &punctelev; fo&rrot; al to fewe doth so
Fo&rrot; alle oþere men wollez abide &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e lif heom beo binome
And ȝeot it is aȝen heo&rrot;e wille &punctelev; þat heo schullen hidere come
And þov art icome al bi þine liue &punctelev; and bi þine guode wille also
Wel ouȝte we þine mede ȝelde &punctelev; and gre[t] þonk also þe do
&YOGH;wane þov ha&slong;t boþe bodi and soule &punctelev; iȝ&ydot;uen us bi þine liue
Saunt faille we ne beoth nouȝt so onku&ydot;nde &punctelev; þat we it nellez ȝelde þe bliue
Fo&rrot; þe kundenesse þat þov to us come &punctelev; al bi þine owene lo&rrot;e
Ake naþeles, ȝif þou wolt on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; habbe Io&ydot;e mo&rrot;e
Sikere us an hond þat þov wolt &punctelev; In o&rrot;e seruise bileue
And we þe wollez aȝen to eo&rrot;þe b&rrot;inge &punctelev; al sauf, are hit beo eue
And þov schalt habbe þare Io&ydot;e inouȝ &punctelev; in halle and eke in boure
Fo&rrot; none men ne fareth so murie þare &punctelev; ase þulke þat beoth ovre
heiȝ man and noble þov schalt beo &punctelev; and alle men schullen honouri þe
&YOGH;wane þov art ded ant come&slong;t to us &punctelev; þou schalt habbe ase guod ase we."
Þis kniȝt þouȝte euere on Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and nolde chaungi is wille
Fo&rrot; þretninge ne fo&rrot; fair bihe&slong;te &punctelev; ake sat him euere &slong;tille
Þo he nolde graunti nouȝt &punctelev; to heom fo&rrot;to wende
heo ȝollen and grenneden on him foule &punctelev; and &slong;trong fu&ydot;r bigonne fo&rrot;to tiende
¶ Þis kniȝt heo bounden honden and fet &punctelev; and amidde þe fu&ydot;re him[Prima pena.] ca&slong;te
With Irene Ovles and pikes &punctelev; heo tod&rrot;owen him wel fa&slong;te
Þis kniȝt hadde gret pine &punctelev; wel loude he cride anon
"Ihesus, Ihesus, help me nouþe &punctelev; and do awei mine fon"
Anon so [he] hadde þis wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; þat fu&ydot;r aqueinte ech sp&rrot;onke
And þe deuelene ne miȝten him non mo&rrot;e tod&rrot;awe. &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd he gan þonke
And þe hardio&rrot;e he was inouȝ &punctelev; þo he þis iseiȝ
And þe lasse he was of heom ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; þat weren him so neiȝ
Wel grisliche heo ȝollen, þe schrewes &punctelev; þo heom faillede heo&rrot;e miȝt
And flouwen echone out of þe halle &punctelev; and d&rrot;owen with heom þis kniȝt
Aȝen þe grounde heo d&rrot;owen him harde &punctelev; boþe bi fet and honde
longe, him þouȝte, and swiþe feo&rrot; &punctelev; alaboute in a wa&slong;te londe
So blac and deo&rrot;k was al þat lond &punctelev; þat noþing he ne seiȝ
bote þe feondes þat him tod&rrot;owen &punctelev; þat so þicke weren him neiȝ
Ake swiþe softe wind þare was &punctelev; þat he heo&rrot;de onneþe
Ake so scharpe he bleuȝ and colde &punctelev; þat b&rrot;ouȝte him neiȝ to deþe
Riȝt colde he wende þo&rrot;uȝ is heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ al is bodi also
Þat him were leouere þane al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; þat þe pine were ido
Þus colde heo d&rrot;owen him, ase heom[r. him] þouȝte &punctelev; fo&rrot;th riȝt e&slong;t, iwis
Ase þe sonne ari&slong;t in somer &punctelev; ȝwane þe dai lenge&slong;t is
Þo heo comen, ase heom[r. p&rrot;ima Secunda1 pena] þouȝte &punctelev; riȝt to þe wo&rrot;ldes ende
bi a b&rrot;od valeie heo to&rrot;neden heom &punctelev; and southward gonne iwende
toward þe &slong;tude þat þe sonne &punctelev; In winter doth arise
Þis seli kniȝt was id&rrot;awe &punctelev; and ipined in fale wise
Þo þouȝte him þat he iheo&rrot;de feo&rrot; &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him ase it were
Swiþe deolful cri and wop &punctelev; and sw&ydot;þe revful bere
Euere þe neo&rrot; þat heo comen &punctelev; þe revlokur was þat cri
So longe [heo] d&rrot;owen him, þat him þouȝte &punctelev; þat heo weren riȝt þerbi
¶ Þo comen heo into a wid feld &punctelev; non mo&rrot;e ne miȝte beo
So long and b&rrot;od in eche side &punctelev; þat he ne miȝte non ende iseo
Of men and of wummen þis feld was &punctelev; ful in eche side
Þe wombene toward þe grounde &punctelev; isp&rrot;adde ab&rrot;od ful wide
hondene and fet al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; to þe eo&rrot;þe fa&slong;te ibounde
With Irene nailles al fu&ydot;rie &punctelev; ismite þo&rrot;uȝ heom to grounde
Þis wrechche go&slong;tes weren[al. om.] so ipinede &punctelev; with Irene and with fu&ydot;re
So deolful cri heo maden þare &punctelev; þat gret deol it was to hu&ydot;re
heo criden merci deolfulliche &punctelev; Ake no merci men nolde heom do
Fo&rrot; Anguische þe eo&rrot;þe heo freten &punctelev; and ho&rrot;e tongene gnowen also
Þe deoulene o&rrot;nen opon hem &punctelev; and treden heom to þe grounde
And with Ovles swiþe kene &punctelev; maden heom mani a wounde.
Allas, ȝw&ydot; nellez men beon iwar &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e sunnes here bete
Are heo comen to purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; and with þe luþere go&slong;tes mete
Fo&rrot; ase wel beth þe schrewes in purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; and oueral, ase in helle
And schullen fo&rrot;to þe daiȝe of dome come &punctelev; telle ȝwat men telle.
Þe feondes seiden, "riȝt ase [þis] men beoth ipinede &punctelev; þov schalt beo also
bote þov wolle þi þouȝt wende &punctelev; and after ovre rede do."
¶ And þo he nolde in none manere &punctelev; to grounde harde heo him ca&slong;te
And to&rrot;menteden him ase þe oþere weren &punctelev; and to þe eo&rrot;þe naileden him fa&slong;te
Ake he criede anon to ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þo him smert so so&rrot;e
Þare nas non of þe schrewes þo &punctelev; þat miȝten serui him so mo&rrot;e
[Tertia pena.]Þo þe schrewes iseiȝen þat heo ne miȝten &punctelev; heo&rrot;e wille habben þo
heo d&rrot;owen him into an oþur felde &punctelev; wel ful of mo&rrot;e wo
Of Men and wummen it was ful &punctelev; opriȝt isp&rrot;ad to grounde
Fet and hondene ato id&rrot;awe &punctelev; and to þe eo&rrot;þe fa&slong;te ibounde
With glowinde biendes al of Ire &punctelev; inailede heo weren þerto
Al fu&ydot;rie nadd&rrot;ene ope heom seten &punctelev; and foule crapoudes also
Some of þe nadd&rrot;ene biclupten heom &punctelev; so fa&slong;te al aboute
Þat heom þouȝte heo scholden tober&slong;te &punctelev; so &slong;treite heo gurden heom withoute
Some seten ope heom &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e flesch altognowe
And with kene tieth al fu&ydot;rie &punctelev; wombe and b&rrot;eo&slong;te tod&rrot;owe
Some with ho&rrot;e scharpe tounges &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ þe heo&rrot;te so&rrot;e heom smite
Some heo gnowen, and some heo &slong;tounge &punctelev; and some with scharpe tieth heom bite
Þe Crapoudes also, þat weren so foule &punctelev; opon heo&rrot;e b&rrot;eo&slong;tene sete
And &slong;toungen heom þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;tene &punctelev; with heo&rrot;e foule wrottes grete
Þe luþere go&slong;tes o&rrot;nen also &punctelev; aboute heom inowe
With hokes and with ouȝles &punctelev; a[nd][MS. a] with gret eir heom tod&rrot;owe
Þe wrechche go&slong;tes, so fo&rrot;pinede &punctelev; in swuch to&rrot;ment weren[al. om.] ib&rrot;ouȝt
heo criden alle deolfulliche &punctelev; ake hit ne halp heom nouȝt
¶ Þe feondes nomen þis seli kniȝt &punctelev; and wolden him pini also
Ake anon so he cride on Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; ne miȝten heo b&rrot;inge him þerto
&YOGH;eot þe feondes eftsone him nomen &punctelev; and to þe þridde feld him[Quarta pena.] b&rrot;ouȝte
In &slong;tronge pine he saiȝ þare wrechche go&slong;tes &punctelev; þat of heomself lu&ydot;te rouȝte
Þat weren isp&rrot;adde on þe eo&rrot;þe ab&rrot;od &punctelev; and ismiten þo&rrot;uȝout echone
with nailes þicke al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; ase þare miȝten &slong;tikie one
Þat man ne miȝte finde ane amtie place &punctelev; on al heo&rrot;e bodie so lu&ydot;te
Þat man miȝte fo&rrot; þe þicke nailles &punctelev; a fingres ende to heom pu&ydot;te
¶ A smart wind also to oþur wo &punctelev; on heom bleuȝ wel fa&slong;te
Þat heom þouȝte heo weren ibarnd &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝout with eche bla&slong;te
Þe feondes o&rrot;nen fa&slong;te aboute &punctelev; fram ech to oþur inowe
And heo&rrot;e wrechche flesch with oþur wo &punctelev; mid Ovles heom tod&rrot;owe
Þeos wrechche go&slong;tes, so furpinede &punctelev; and in swuch to&rrot;ment ib&rrot;ouȝt
Revliche heo criden ase heo miȝten &punctelev; ake it ne halp heom riȝt nouȝt
Fo&rrot; heo weren so clene ouercome &punctelev; þat heo ne miȝten onneþe
Ani voiz outb&rrot;inge bote ase a man &punctelev; þat were ope þe pointe of deþe
In heo&rrot;e þrote heo criden dimmeliche &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e &slong;trencþe heom was binome
With muche pine, and no wonder it nas &punctelev; þei heo weren ouercome
Þe feondes nomen þis seli kniȝt &punctelev; and to grounde him ca&slong;te
And seiden, bote he wolde turne is þouȝt &punctelev; heo wolden naili him þare wel fa&slong;te
Ake he cride on Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and nemde is holi name
Þe schrewes ne hadden none miȝte þo &punctelev; to don him mo&rrot;e schame
[Quinta pena.]&YOGH;eot heo nomen and d&rrot;owen him &punctelev; into þe feo&rrot;þe felde
Ful of b&rrot;um&slong;ton al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; with &slong;tronge leiȝe and spelde
¶ Ech manere pine þat miȝte beo &punctelev; In þulke felde he seiȝ
Some with chaines of Ire &punctelev; al fu&ydot;rie, hengen on heiȝ
Some bi Armes, some bi fet &punctelev; and bi þe necke mani on
heo weren anhangede in &slong;tronge fu&ydot;re &punctelev; of pich and eke b&rrot;um&slong;ton
Some hengen bi &slong;tronge crokus &punctelev; Ipulte þo&rrot;uȝ eiþur E&ydot;ȝe
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe þrote some also &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ eiþur ere wel heiȝe
And some þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e derne limes &punctelev; and some þo&rrot;uȝ þe tete
Þat leuere heom were þane al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; heo&rrot;e l&ydot;f to habbe ilete
Some opon grediles of Ire &punctelev; iro&slong;tede weren also
Some ase g&ydot;es, þe spites of Ire &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝout heom ido
Some le&ydot;en op&rrot;iȝt aȝein þe grounde &punctelev; ȝeonijnde wel fa&slong;te
Þe feondes welden led and b&rrot;as &punctelev; and in heo&rrot;e mouþes ca&slong;te
he ne miȝte biþenche no manere pine &punctelev; þat he ne saiȝ mo þer
him þouȝte he saiȝ þare mani on &punctelev; þat he knev on eo&rrot;þe her
Þe feondes him ca&slong;ten amidde þis pine &punctelev; among þis oþere echon
And he cride on Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and was deliured anon
[Sexta pena.]¶ &YOGH;eot þis feondes þis selie kniȝt &punctelev; into an oþur place hu&ydot; d&rrot;owe
ÞareInne he isaiȝ a grislich ȝweol &punctelev; with spokene longe inowe
Þat on ende hangede toward þe grounde &punctelev; þat oþur opon heiȝ
Ful it was of hokes and pikes &punctelev; wel þicke, ase he iseiȝ
Þis hokes and þis pikes weren &punctelev; fa&slong;te iriuen also
With wrechche go&slong;tes alaboute &punctelev; þat þaron weren ido
Al b&rrot;enninde was þis so&rrot;ie ȝweol &punctelev; and &slong;tinkinde of b&rrot;um&slong;ton
Þe wrechche go&slong;tes þat þaron hengen &punctelev; b&rrot;enninde weren echon
Þis feondes wenden fo&rrot;th anon &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e hokes þaron ca&slong;te
In eiþur side, a[nd][MS. a] tur[n]den aboute &punctelev; þis so&rrot;i ȝweol so fa&slong;te
Þat of þe go&slong;tus þat þaron hengen &punctelev; noþing heo ne seiȝe
So fa&slong;te heo to&rrot;neden þat ȝweol aboute— &punctelev; bote þe b&rrot;enninde leiȝe
Ake deolfulliche heo criden and ȝollen &punctelev; euerech in is ende.
Alas, ȝwi nellez men beon iwar &punctelev; are heo heonnes wende
&YOGH;wane he miȝten here with a lu&ydot;tel pine &punctelev; bete heo&rrot;e misdede
And þare heo schullen so bitere abugge &punctelev; alas, þe wrechhede
Þis feondes nomen þis seli kniȝt &punctelev; and on þis ȝweol him ca&slong;te
And with þis oþere wrechche go&slong;tes &punctelev; to&rrot;neden him aboute fa&slong;te
Sone he cride on Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; deliuered he was anon
Þe feondes &slong;toden and biheolden &punctelev; with d&rrot;eo&rrot;i mod echon
[Septima pena.]¶ Eft heo nomen him bitterliche &punctelev; and ferro&rrot;e ȝu&ydot;t him ladde
And harleden him fo&rrot;th wel revfulliche &punctelev; and loude ȝollen and gradde
bifo&rrot;e him he saiȝ an hous &slong;tonde &punctelev; long and b&rrot;od inovȝ
stunch and hete þat þarof cam &punctelev; him þouȝte alme&slong;t [him] aslouȝ
he with&slong;tod, and nolde, is þonkes &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;tunche gon non ner
"Ferro&rrot;e þov schalt," þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þou ne schalt nouȝt abide her
A bath it is þat þov isijc&slong;t &punctelev; and þarinne þov schalt beo
And baþi with oþere þat þare beoth &punctelev; ne schalt þov nouȝt so fleo."
Þe go&slong;tes þat þareinne weren &punctelev; wel deolfulliche cride
And ȝollen loude, ase he iheo&rrot;de &punctelev; aboute in eche side
Þis kniȝt with þis foule wiȝtes &punctelev; Into þe grete house cam
Of to&rrot;mens þat he þare isaiȝ &punctelev; gret gome withalle he nam
ful of puttes and of diches &punctelev; þat hous withinne it was
Mo&rrot;e seo&rrot;uwe ne mo&rrot;e &slong;tunch &punctelev; neuere iseiȝe nas
heo weren folle of &slong;tronge to&rrot;mens &punctelev; boillinde euerechon
Of wallinde led, and ifulde heo weren &punctelev; of piche and b&rrot;um&slong;ton
Wrechche go&slong;tus þareinne seten &punctelev; þe to&rrot;ment tilde wel heiȝe
Some aboue þe heued &punctelev; and some riȝt to þe E&ydot;ȝe
Some to þe nose, and some to þe mouth &punctelev; and some op to þe swere
And some to heo&rrot;e b&rrot;eo&slong;tene &punctelev; and abouȝten heo&rrot;e sunnes ful deo&rrot;e
And some to heo&rrot;e nauele &punctelev; and some neþerro&rrot;e mo&rrot;e
And some &slong;toden op to heo&rrot;e knen &punctelev; and criden and weopen so&rrot;e
And some &slong;toden In with boþe fet &punctelev; and some with þat on
Deolfolliche heo weopen and criden &punctelev; and ȝollen euerechon
¶ "Nov þov isixt," queþen þe feondes &punctelev; "ȝwoderIn þov schalt gon
bote þov wolle anoþur speke &punctelev; and to us tu&ydot;rne anon."
heo nomen and ca&slong;ten him In a putte. &punctelev; on Iesus anon he cride
Op he cam anon aȝen &punctelev; and no lengo&rrot;e he ne mo&slong;te þare abide
[Octaua pena.]heo nomen him in grete wrathþe &punctelev; and harleden him ferrere mo&rrot;e
And b&rrot;ouȝten him opon a sw&ydot;þe gret hul &punctelev; ful of so&rrot;ewe and so&rrot;e
he &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; þo he cam þareop an heiȝ
him wond&rrot;ede of þe manie go&slong;tes &punctelev; þat he þare iseiȝ
Alle þe pinene[al. þat alle] þat he hadde er iseiȝe &punctelev; þareaȝen nouȝt nere
Icluiȝte heo seten ope heo&rrot;e ton &punctelev; and quakeden revliche fo&rrot; fere
In þe southhalf of þe hul &punctelev; a deop water þare was and louȝ
Þat foule &slong;tonk, and caldo&rrot;e was &punctelev; þane ani &ydot;s oþur snovȝ
A no&rrot;þerne wind fa&slong;te blevȝ &punctelev; þat him þouȝte is flesch torende
Euere þare seten go&slong;tes &punctelev; and aȝein þe winde heom wende
heo quakeden and ch&ydot;uereden fa&slong;te &punctelev; in grete pine and &slong;tronge
Ase hoso seith abidet þare heo&rrot;e time &punctelev; heo&rrot;e deth fo&rrot;to afonge
"lo," seide on of þe feondes &punctelev; "þov no&slong;t nouȝt ȝwat i&slong;tis
bote þov to&rrot;ne þi þouȝt sone &punctelev; þou schalt iwite, iwis."
Ne hadde he bote þis wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam a wind blowe
And d&rrot;of alle þis wrechche go&slong;tes &punctelev; into þe deope watur ful lowe
¶ Þe No&rrot;þerne w&ydot;nd d&rrot;of heom adoun &punctelev; al mid one bla&slong;te
And alle þe go&slong;tes, and þene kniȝt &punctelev; amidde þe watere hem ca&slong;te
Mo&rrot;e pine ne miȝte non beo &punctelev; of &slong;tronge chele ne of &slong;tunche
Þane þis go&slong;tes þarinne hadden &punctelev; þare ne miȝte non atblenche
Þo þe kniȝt þe &slong;tronge pine &punctelev; of þis water ifelde
he gan to crie on Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat faillede him ful selde
Anonriȝt withoute lette &punctelev; op of þis watere man him[al. he (man om.)] d&rrot;ovȝ
Ake þis wrechche go&slong;tes lefden þere &punctelev; with so&rrot;ewe and wo inovȝ
Fo&rrot; in þat water, þat was so cold &punctelev; and so foule &slong;tonk also
Þis go&slong;tes sw&ydot;mden op and doun &punctelev; in muche so&rrot;ewe and wo
Þe feondes o&rrot;nen opon þe watere &punctelev; so men doth on þe londe
And ȝwane ani wolde coueri[al. cleueri] op &punctelev; with fote oþur with honde
heo pulten him adoun aȝen &punctelev; þat þare ne ascapede non
Þare was wo and so&rrot;ewe inouȝ &punctelev; among heom euerechon
¶ Þis feondes wenden fo&rrot;th anon &punctelev; and þe seli kniȝt eft nome
And d&rrot;owen him into a so&rrot;i &slong;tude &punctelev; þare neuer er heo ne come
heo comen and &slong;toden ouer a put &punctelev; w&ydot;d it was and deop inovȝ
A b&rrot;enninde smoke, þat foule &slong;tonk &punctelev; op of þe putte d&rrot;ovȝ
Þat onneþe þe kn&ydot;ȝt miȝte &slong;tonde &punctelev; fo&rrot; so&rrot;i &slong;tunch þareneiȝ
Wrechche go&slong;tes in þis put &punctelev; in þat so&rrot;i smoke he seiȝ
Fleo op and doun al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; ase speldene doth of fu&ydot;re
And into þe putte eft fullen adoun &punctelev; þo heo ne miȝten no leng du&ydot;re
him þouȝte he was al ouercome &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe &slong;tunche þat þarop of d&rrot;ovȝ
Þarebi him þouȝte þat in þe grounde &punctelev; was so&rrot;uwe and deol inovȝ
"&YOGH;w&ydot; &slong;tan&slong;t þov so" þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þinchþ þe þarof wonder
Of þis swete smoke þat here bloweth &punctelev; and ȝwat put beo þareonder
[Puteum Inferni.]¶ In þis put is ovre woneingue &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe put of helle it is
And, fo&rrot; þov us ha&slong;t iserued wel &punctelev; here þov schalt wonie, iwis
Fo&rrot; alle þat us seruieth wel &punctelev; hidere heo schullen wende
And, ȝif þov come&slong;t herein with us &punctelev; þov wo&rrot;&slong;t here withouten ende
Þarefo&rrot;e i rede to&rrot;ne þi þouȝt &punctelev; and do us here manrede
And we schullen þene wei ase we come[MS. conne] &punctelev; al sauf aȝen þe lede
Þov schalt on eo&rrot;þe al þi lijf habbe &punctelev; richesse, and Io&ydot;e also
Fo&rrot; we schullen on eo&rrot;þe þe finde inovȝ &punctelev; ase riȝt is þat we do."
Þo þe kniȝt fo&rrot;sok heo&rrot;e bihe&slong;te &punctelev; ase he hadde er ilome
heo smiten heom adoun into þe putte &punctelev; and þene kniȝt with heom nome
Þe deoppo&rrot;e þat heo comen &punctelev; þ[e] b&rrot;addere þe put was
Ake[al. þat] al þe wo þat he isaiȝ er &punctelev; aȝein þat nouȝt it nas
Of &slong;tunch, of b&rrot;enninge, and of oþur wo &punctelev; þe kniȝt was so ouercome
Þat is þovȝt toward Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; neiȝ him was binome
So muche pine nas neuere iseiȝe— &punctelev; him þouȝte ase þei he felde
Þat he was neiȝ ope þe pointe &punctelev; þene go&slong;t op to ȝelde
Ake o&rrot;e louerd among al is wo &punctelev; grace him ȝaf atþe la&slong;te
Þat he þouȝte on Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and to him cride [fa&slong;te].[MS. atþe la&slong;te]
A smoke þare cam smite up anon &punctelev; mid one wel &slong;tronge bla&slong;te
Þene kniȝt an heiȝ aboue þe putte &punctelev; and manie oþere[al. om.] go&slong;tes, ca&slong;te
Þe kniȝt ȝwirlede op in þis bla&slong;t &punctelev; ase speldene doth, wel wide
Atþe la&slong;te he liȝte adoun &punctelev; aboue þe putte bi side
Þare he &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; ase man þat witles were
Þat fo&rrot; þe pine þat he hadde ihaued &punctelev; he nu&slong;te hov he cam þere
Þo he hadde longe i&slong;tonde al one &punctelev; and biholde aboute
Þare comen bla&slong;te op of þe putte &punctelev; deuelene a gret rouȝte
And [&slong;toden] bi him al aboute &punctelev; al newe as þei heo were
Ase him þouȝte, he ne saiȝ hem &punctelev; neuer er bote þo þere
heo biheolden him wel grisliche &punctelev; and grenneden on him alaboute
And seiden, "ȝwi &slong;tan&slong;t þov here al one &punctelev; þov mo&slong;t come into ovre rovte."
heo seiden, "tolden o&rrot;e felawes þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle
hit nis nouȝt so, ake we wollez sone &punctelev; fo&rrot; riȝte soþe þe telle
No&slong;tþov nouȝt þat it is o&rrot;e riȝte &punctelev; to liȝen eueremo
And þat we with lesingues bitraieth men &punctelev; bote it mowe oþur go
And so o&rrot;e felawes louwen þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle
Ake þov schalt come þudere with us &punctelev; and þe soþe we wollez þe telle."
¶ Þis deouelene harleden þane kniȝt fo&rrot;th &punctelev; þat wo was him tod&rrot;awe
Þat him were leouere þane aniþing &punctelev; þat he hadde ibeo of lifdawe
So þat heo comen to a sw&ydot;þe gret watur &punctelev; deop and b&rrot;od inovȝ
A &slong;trong mi&slong;t, þat foule &slong;tonk &punctelev; op of þis watere d&rrot;ovȝ
Of b&rrot;um&slong;ton and of oþur wo— &punctelev; so &slong;trong &slong;tunch neuere he ne seiȝ
Þat mid al þe pine of þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; onneþe he &slong;tod þereneiȝ
A b&rrot;ugge þare was ouer þat watur &punctelev; smallere ne miȝte non beo
Þe smoke was so þicke alaboute &punctelev; þat onneþe he miȝte [it] iseo
þo seiden þe so&rrot;ie fendes &punctelev; "we seggez þe iwis
Þat onder þis deope watere &punctelev; þe put of helle so is
And þat þov schalt sone iwite &punctelev; fo&rrot; þov schalt sone anon
ouer þis watur, þat is so deop &punctelev; opon þis b&rrot;ugge gon
And we schullen þe sende swuch a w&ydot;nd &punctelev; þat schal þe amidde ca&slong;te
And o&rrot;e felawes þat beoth bineothe &punctelev; schullen þe nime wel fa&slong;te
And d&rrot;awe þe doun fo&rrot;th with hem &punctelev; Into helle grounde anon
Cum novþe fo&rrot;th and þouȝ schalt &punctelev; opon þis b&rrot;ugge gon."
heo nomen þis seli kniȝt &punctelev; and opon þis b&rrot;ugge d&rrot;owe
And maden him go þere, is onþonkes &punctelev; with wrechhedes inowe
Þreo þingus vuele inowe &punctelev; on þis b&rrot;ugge were
Þat on was, fo&rrot; heo was so heiȝ &punctelev; þat no go&slong;t ne[al. vnneþe me] miȝte fo&rrot; fere
Þareoppe gon and so deope adoun &punctelev; habbe so grisliche siȝte
Þat oþur was, fo&rrot; heo was so narovȝ &punctelev; þat onneþe aniþing[al. me] miȝte
Þareoppe sette ani fot &punctelev; þat he ne fulle adoun anon
Þe þridde, þat heo was so slider &punctelev; þat man ne miȝte þareoppe gon
bote he slide and felle adoun &punctelev; so sleiȝ man neuere nere
Þeos þreo þinges þesne selie kniȝt &punctelev; b&rrot;ouȝten in grete fere
Fo&rrot; heo was narovȝ, and slider, and heiȝ &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him so bitelle
&YOGH;if þat he glufte[al. glide] in ani half &punctelev; þat he ne fulle into helle
¶ Þareoppe he was with &slong;trencþe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; and þareoppe imaket to gon
So gret d&rrot;ede, ase him þouȝte &punctelev; ne hadde he neuer er non
Ake sone he þouȝte on ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat so ofte him sauede er
And cride on is holie name &punctelev; þat he were is helpe þer
he eode fo&rrot;th we[l] baldeliche &punctelev; and þe inno&rrot;e þat he cam
Þe hardio&rrot;e him þouȝte he was &punctelev; and þe betere heo&rrot;te to him he nam
And þe b&rrot;addo&rrot;e was is wei— &punctelev; so longe fo&rrot;th he eode
Þat it was so b&rrot;od þat þere miȝte &punctelev; a carte gon fo&rrot; neode
And so longe, þat tuei cartes miȝte &punctelev; meten heom wel inovȝ
Þe kniȝt þo wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase a mai&slong;ter fo&rrot;th him d&rrot;ouȝ
Þe feondes &slong;toden bineþe þe b&rrot;ugge &punctelev; and seiȝen him so fa&slong;te gon
And fo&rrot; al þe wo þat heo him duden &punctelev; ne ouercam him nouȝt on
heom þouȝte, it was al fo&rrot; nouȝt &punctelev; after him to honten mo&rrot;e
grisliche heo gonne fo&rrot;to ȝeolle &punctelev; ant to crie and wepe su&ydot;þe so&rrot;e
Þat fo&rrot; þe ȝeollinge þat heo maden &punctelev; he hadde wel mo&rrot;e fere
Þane of al þe pine þat he hadde er &punctelev; so lodlich was þe bere
¶ heo&rrot;e Oules heo nomen and heo&rrot;e hokes &punctelev; and toward him ca&slong;ten an heiȝ
Ake þare nas non þat him touchi miȝte &punctelev; ne noþing come him neiȝ
So þat al sauf with alle Io&ydot;e &punctelev; ouer þis watere he him d&rrot;ovȝ
And þe feondes lefden bihinde &punctelev; with grete so&rrot;uwe ant so&rrot; inouȝ
In helle is heo&rrot;e ku&ydot;nde heritage &punctelev; and elles fo&rrot;soþe it were wovȝ
heo leten him go ȝwodere he wolde &punctelev; and ne fondeden him non mo&rrot;e
And heolden heom cleneliche ouercome &punctelev; fo&rrot; al heo&rrot;e false lo&rrot;e
Þis kniȝt wende him fo&rrot;th, sauf inouȝ— &punctelev; þat he hadde ero&rrot;e deo&rrot;e a|bouȝt
And þonkede ȝeo&rrot;ne Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat þe feondes ne siweden him nouȝt
Þat watur he passede sauf inovȝ &punctelev; and fo&rrot;þere þene we&ydot; he nam
Þe contrie him þouȝte murie inouȝ &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;th þat he cam
Þe fo&rrot;þere þat he wende &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e murevþe he seiȝ
So [longe] þat he isaiȝ ane wal &punctelev; swiþe noble and heiȝ
So riche weo&rrot;k nas neuere iseiȝe &punctelev; ase him [þouȝte] þat þaron was
And sw&ydot;þe fair ȝat þaron he saiȝ &punctelev; þat neuere swuch iseiȝe nas
Þat ȝat schon sw&ydot;þe b&rrot;iȝte &punctelev; ase þei it al gold were
Folle of derewurþe &slong;tones ipiȝte &punctelev; none richere neuere nere
him þouȝte, are he þudere cam &punctelev; is wei ful longe la&slong;te
Þo he cam fo&rrot;þere a lu&ydot;tel wiȝt &punctelev; he &slong;tod and biheold it fa&slong;te
Þat [ȝat][om.] wende op aȝen him &punctelev; and anonriȝt with þe dede
Þare cam smite out a swote smel &punctelev; and wide aboute gan sp&rrot;ede
Þat him þouȝte, þei al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; swote spices were
So muche swotnesse ne miȝte ȝiuen &punctelev; ase þat suote smul dude þere
In so gret Io&ydot;e him þouȝte he was &punctelev; þat þei he hadde beo ib&rrot;ouȝt
Into al þe so&rrot;uwe þat he was er &punctelev; it ne schulde him habbe igreued nouȝt
he biheold in at þis ȝate &punctelev; þo he cam þerneiȝ
Mo&rrot;e clernesse nas neuere iseiȝe &punctelev; him þouȝte, þane he þere iseiȝ
Ase he wolde þareIn wende &punctelev; aȝein him þare cam gon
A p&rrot;ocession fair inovȝ &punctelev; of noble men echon
with creoiz and with taperes &punctelev; and with baneres clere
Ireue&slong;ted faire muche folk was &punctelev; and ech hadde is fere
Some were bischopus and Ercedeknes &punctelev; and some Monekes and freres
And euerech, him þouȝte, hadde þe Abite &punctelev; þat heo wereden here
with þe me&slong;te Io&ydot;e þat miȝte beo &punctelev; þis kniȝt was onderfonge
And ilad In with Io&ydot;e inovȝ &punctelev; mid solas and murie songe
Þo þis murie song was ido &punctelev; to him sone þare come
Tweien ase it mai&slong;tres weren &punctelev; and bi þe honde him nome
And welcomeden him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkeden o&rrot;e louerd fa&slong;te
Þat him sende so guode bileue &punctelev; so &slong;tableliche fo&rrot;to la&slong;te
heo ladden him aboute and scheweden him &punctelev; þat lond fer and ner
So muche Ioie and clernesse &punctelev; him þouȝte he ne saiȝ neuer er
¶ Ase þe sonne binimez þe liȝt &punctelev; of Candle aboute Midda&ydot;
Also it binam þe sonne hire leom &punctelev; him þouȝte, ase[al. þe liȝt þat] he þare isaiȝ
So long and b&rrot;od þe place was &punctelev; þat he ne miȝte non ende iseo
A fair Medwe he saiȝ[al. Al murie med] with swete floures : swottere ne miȝte non beo
Treon also with noble fru&ydot;t &punctelev; þat smulde swote Inovȝ
And þe[al. So gret] swotnesse of euerech &slong;tude &punctelev; al aboute op d&rrot;ouȝ
Þat þare withoute mete and d&rrot;unch &punctelev; him þouȝte, eueremo
he miȝte libbe with alle Ioie &punctelev; ȝif he mo&slong;te þareInne go
It was þere euere iliche liȝt &punctelev; and euere it was dai
So muche folk in none place, him þouȝte &punctelev; neuer er he ne saiȝ
Ech Compa&ydot;gnie to oþur d&rrot;ovȝ &punctelev; and ech bi oþur &slong;tod
With murie song and Melodie &punctelev; and gladnesse in heo&rrot;e mod
Þat ech of oþur þe mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e &punctelev; togadere heo miȝten afonge
Almiȝti god, þat heom schop &punctelev; heo hereden In heo&rrot;e songe
And ase sum &slong;teo&rrot;re þat ȝe iseoth &punctelev; b&rrot;iȝto&rrot;e þane oþur is
Also was bi heom, fo&rrot; some weren &punctelev; clero&rrot;e þane some, iwis
Ake þulke þat me&slong;t dosk was &punctelev; him þouȝte, was mo&rrot;e cler
And b&rrot;iȝto&rrot;e schon, þane ani gold &punctelev; þat he isaiȝ euer er
¶ Ech werede cloþes of þe entaile &punctelev; þat heo wereden on eo&rrot;þe here
Monekes ase it to Monek bifeol &punctelev; and freres ase to frere
So þat heo hadden heo&rrot;e riȝte fourme &punctelev; ake wel b&rrot;iȝto&rrot;e was ho&rrot;e hev
Ant ȝwat men heo were on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; bi heo&rrot;e cloþinge he knev
Some hadden þe croune of golde &punctelev; anouewarde þe heued ido
And some beren in heo&rrot;e hond &punctelev; ȝeo&rrot;dene of golde also
And alle heo þonkeden Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat so &slong;tudefa&slong;t heo&rrot;te him sende
Þe kniȝt, fo&rrot; al þe pine þat he hadde &punctelev; is heo&rrot;te enes ne wende
Echone heom þouȝte þat fo&rrot; him &punctelev; In þe mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e heo were
he &slong;tod and biheold al þis Ioie &punctelev; as þei no wit on him nere
Þe on, ase it heo&rrot;e mai&slong;ter were &punctelev; is Mouth ondude wel softe
And welcomede him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkede o&rrot;e louerd ofte
Þat swuch po&rrot;pos him hadde isend &punctelev; and &slong;tudefa&slong;t heo&rrot;te also
Þat he ne chaungede nouȝt is þouȝt &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat him was ido
"bev frere," he seide, "iherd beo god &punctelev; þat þe hauez hidere ib&rrot;ouȝt
And among alle þine &slong;tronge fon &punctelev; &slong;tudefa&slong;t iwu&slong;t þi þouȝt
Of þe pine of sunfule go&slong;tes &punctelev; Ifondet þov haue&slong;t inouȝ
And þarewith þine sunnes ibet &punctelev; and elles it were wouȝ
¶ Þov miȝt here sumdel iseo &punctelev; þat þov wilne&slong;t mo&rrot;e
Of þe Io&ydot;e þat guode soulene habbez &punctelev; þat comieth to milce and o&rrot;e
Þis place þat we inne beoth &punctelev; ich wene þov ne knowe&slong;t nouȝt
It is eo&rrot;þelich para&ydot;s &punctelev; þat Adam was Inne ib&rrot;ouȝt
And þat he was Inne &ydot;mad &punctelev; and sethþe fo&rrot; is misdede
he was ica&slong;t out þarof, and we also &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe into alle wrechchehede
¶ Al þe Io&ydot;e þat þov isixt her &punctelev; he hadde to is wille
Ake he ne miȝte, þo he was out ica&slong;t &punctelev; þarof iseo wurth a fille
Of wrechhede we beoth ikened &punctelev; and of sunful blode icome
And þat us is þo&rrot;uȝ godes grace &punctelev; ant þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e cri&slong;tinedom binome
Ak þat we aftur o&rrot;e cri&slong;tindom &punctelev; of sunne on eo&rrot;þe wrouȝte
On eo&rrot;þe oþur in purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; wel deo&rrot;e we it bouȝte
Fo&rrot; we alle þat þou here isixt &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;th hidere come
And o&rrot;e sunnes þare betten &punctelev; and harde penaunce nome
Ne miȝte we elles here come. &punctelev; ase guod bi þe it is
Fo&rrot; ȝif þine sunnes nere fo&rrot;ȝiue &punctelev; þov ne come nouȝt here, iwis
And alle þat þov þare iseiȝe &punctelev; to us þudere heo schullen wende
And al dai doth some, ȝwane heo habbez &punctelev; heo&rrot;e penaunce ib&rrot;ouȝt to ende
Neuer on not hov longe he schal &punctelev; þare bileue, iwis
Fo&rrot; hoso ani freond on eo&rrot;þe hath &punctelev; mid him þe betere it is
Þo&rrot;uȝ massene and þo&rrot;uȝ oþur beden &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ almesdede
Man mai ho&rrot;e pine muche alegge &punctelev; and þe sono&rrot;e ovt þarof heom lede
And ȝwane ani of heom hidere comez &punctelev; aȝen him we wendez echon
Ase we duden aȝein þe, with Io&ydot;e &punctelev; and ledez him In anon
Ake non of us nis ȝu&ydot;t wu&ydot;rthþe &punctelev; into heuene fo&rrot;to wende
Ne neuere on not ȝwane ovre louerd &punctelev; after ani of us wole sende
Fo&rrot; ech man þat into heuene schal &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ purgato&rrot;ie mot
And sethþe into eo&rrot;þeliche para&ydot;s &punctelev; ase we beoth novþe, wel ich wot
Fo&rrot; þis is ovre ku&ydot;nde heritage &punctelev; iwrouȝt we weren þarto
Al fo&rrot;to o&rrot;e fur&slong;te fader it agulte &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to he hadde misdo
here we scholden alle habbe ibeon ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and ileoued o&rrot;e lif also
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd wold þat we weren &punctelev; In þe mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e ido
Þei men beon ovt heonnes ica&slong;t &punctelev; herefo&rrot;th heo moten wende
And[om. and] aȝen, ar heo to heouene come &punctelev; aftur heo&rrot;e liues ende
Ake al þe Io&ydot;e þat is here &punctelev; nis noþing, iwis
Aȝein þe le&slong;te Io&ydot;e of heouene &punctelev; wel muche þe me&slong;te is
Sumþing þov schalt of heuene iseo &punctelev; In a place hereneiȝ."
he ladde him opon an heiȝ hul &punctelev; and bad him biholde on heiȝ
And axede him of ȝwuch colur were &punctelev; heuene opriȝt þere
he seide, him þouȝte riȝt ase gold &punctelev; þat pu&ydot;r wallinde were
"&YOGH;e," seide þis oþur, "þis is þe wei &punctelev; þat geth riȝt to heuene blis
And þat is þe ȝat of para&ydot;s &punctelev; þat withoute heuene ȝeond is
¶ Ech da&ydot; some of purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; comez hidere us to
And some of us to heuene wendez &punctelev; euereche da&ydot;e also
So þat [we] wexez eche daie &punctelev; and waniez, þov sixt lo
We nutez ȝwuch of us it schal beo next &punctelev; bote as god wole habbe ido
Ech dai þe ȝwu&ydot;le we here beoth &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd us fedez ene
with riche metes of heuene &punctelev; þat swete is and clene
ȝwuche þulke metes beon &punctelev; are þov heonnes wende
with us þov schalt sone iwite &punctelev; ȝwane god it wole us sende."
Ne hadde he bote o wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam aliȝte
A manere b&rrot;ez fram heouene adoun &punctelev; þat schon wel clere and b&rrot;iȝte
Þat ouersp&rrot;adde al þat lond &punctelev; and a cler leome þarewithoute
And[al. om.] opon euereches heued aliȝte adoun &punctelev; wel faire, withouten doute,[al. clero&rrot;e þane aboute]
And opon þis kniȝtes heued also &punctelev; an þo&rrot;uȝ him smot anon
And þo&rrot;uȝ euerech lime and lith of him &punctelev; þat swete liȝt gan gon
Þa[t] so muche wille[r. winne] and Io&ydot;e &punctelev; him þouȝte, neuere he nadde
he &slong;tod, ase þei he were inomen &punctelev; fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e þat he þo hadde
&YOGH;weþur he were quik oþur ded &punctelev; bote ase he in metingue were
louerd, murie is þe Io&ydot;e of heuene &punctelev; ase he ifelde wel þere
Ake it ne la&slong;te heom bote lu&ydot;tele ȝwile &punctelev; þat þe leome ne with|d&rrot;ovȝ
And naþeles, þei it lu&ydot;te la&slong;te &punctelev; þarof heo weren fulle inovȝ
Þe kniȝt &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; and is riȝte &slong;tat onder&slong;tod
So fol he was of þat holi leome &punctelev; þat so swete was and guod
him þouȝte, þei he leouede eueremo&rrot;e &punctelev; and neuereft mo&rrot;e ne ete
Ne scholde him neuereft to mete lu&slong;te &punctelev; so guod was þe leome and swete
"Lo," seide þis oþur go&slong;t &punctelev; þat schewede him al þis place
"Sumdel þov ha&slong;t nouþe iseiȝe &punctelev; of o&rrot;e louerdes grace
¶ Of þe pine þat þe wrechche go&slong;tes &punctelev; habbeth fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e mis|dede
And of þe Io&ydot;e þat guode go&slong;tes &punctelev; in para&ydot;s doth lede
And sumdel of þe grete Ioie &punctelev; þat in þe riȝte heuene is
Eche daiȝe we beoth ifedde &punctelev; ones with swuche Ioie and blis
And þanne beo we al dai fulle inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot;to o&rrot;e louerd mo&rrot;e us sende
In swuche Ioie heo beoth þat beoth in heouene &punctelev; and wo&rrot;þez with|oute ende
And ȝu&ydot;t sumdel in mo&rrot;e &punctelev; it ne faillez heom neuere mo
And we ne beoth a da&ydot; bote enes &punctelev; fo&rrot;to we þudere go
And ȝwan þat we þudere comieth &punctelev; we schulle withouten ende
And þou, ȝif þov aserue&slong;t heuene fo&rrot;th &punctelev; þudere fo&rrot;to wende
Þov miȝt don ase þov wolt &punctelev; ȝwane þov come&slong;t to eo&rrot;þe, iwis
And þudere anon aȝen þou mo&slong;t— &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe, at þe time it is
And ȝif þov wolt guod lif lede &punctelev; þine mede þov miȝt iseo
And ȝwat pine heo habbez, þov ha&slong;t iseie &punctelev; þat luþere wollez beo
Aȝein þou mo&slong;t wende anon &punctelev; go fo&rrot;th agodes name
Fo&rrot; sikerliche þov miȝt gon &punctelev; þe feondes ne mowen don þe no schame
heo beoth ad&rrot;adde wel so&rrot;e of þe &punctelev; and aschamede in eche side
Agodes name go fo&rrot;th þi wei &punctelev; þov ne miȝt no leng here abide"
"A, sire, merci" quath þis kniȝt &punctelev; "bitide ȝwat me bitide
A fote inelle fram eov go &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrechchehede[MS. hedede] goth so wide
¶ Ake soffriez me bileue here with ov &punctelev; fo&rrot;, ȝif ich fram eov wende
Ad&rrot;ad ich am of þe feondene miȝte &punctelev; la&slong;te heo with sunne me schende."
"Do wei, beu frere," þis oþur seide &punctelev; "ase wel þov miȝt beo &slong;tille
Aȝen þov schalt to eo&rrot;þe anon &punctelev; and[al. om.] þov miȝt don þare þine wille
And ȝif þov serue&slong;t wel o&rrot;e louerd þere &punctelev; siker þov miȝt beo
to comen aȝein hidere to us &punctelev; and sethþe to heuene fteo
Agodes half wend aȝen anon &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe, þov schalt so."
"Alas, alas" quath þis kniȝt &punctelev; "ȝwat schal ich nouþe do
Al þe Io&ydot;e þat ich habbe nouþe iseiȝe &punctelev; it wo&rrot;th me binome
And to þe wrechhede of þe wo&rrot;lde &punctelev; alas, schal ich novþe come"
Ovt ate ȝate heo b&rrot;ouȝten him &punctelev; wepinde, at þe la&slong;te
And beden him gon wel hardiliche &punctelev; and herien o&rrot;e louerd wel fa&slong;te
Anon so he was withoute igon &punctelev; þat ȝat heo maden wel bliue
With d&rrot;eo&rrot;i mod he wende aȝen &punctelev; and was ad&rrot;ad of is liue
Ase he cam er, with careful mod &punctelev; þene wei aȝein he nam
And, ȝwane ani deuel þat him pinede er &punctelev; ouȝwere aȝen him cam
Ase wode schrewene heo flouwen fa&slong;te &punctelev; and ne do&rrot;&slong;ten abide him nouȝt
So atþe la&slong;te þis kniȝt was &punctelev; to þe halle aȝein ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þare as þe holie compa&ydot;gnie &punctelev; þuderward to him wende
And sat him adoun wel softe þere &punctelev; fo&rrot;to o&rrot;e louerd him grace sende
Ase he sat and biheold aboute &punctelev; to him heo comen þere
Al þat faire compa&ydot;gnie &punctelev; þat aȝein him cam er
And honoureden him wel faire &punctelev; and confo&rrot;teden him wel fa&slong;te
And þonkeden Iesus, godes sone &punctelev; þat his bileue so wel ila&slong;te
¶ "bev frere," heo seiden, "ȝwane þov ha&slong;t &punctelev; swuch penaunce i|d&rrot;iue
Siker beo þou þat þine sunnes &punctelev; al clene þe beoth fo&rrot;ȝiue
loke, ȝwane þov come&slong;t to eo&rrot;þe aȝen &punctelev; þat þov clene lif lede
So þat þov neuereft in pine ne come &punctelev; fo&rrot; sunne ne fo&rrot; misdede
Þov mo&slong;t don þe heonnes anon &punctelev; fo&rrot; at hom in þine londe
hit dawez clere and is neiȝ dai &punctelev; ase ich me onder&slong;tonde
And þe p&rrot;io&rrot; with p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; to þe ȝate comez wel sone
to loki ȝweþur þov beo icome &punctelev; ase riȝt is fo&rrot;to done
And, bote he þe finde þere &punctelev; he wole maken þat ȝat anon
And wole beo siker þat þou ne come&slong;t nonmo&rrot;e &punctelev; and so&rrot;i wole aȝen gon."[This verse on the margin.]
Þene kniȝt heo b&rrot;ouȝten out of þe halle &punctelev; and blesseden him echon
And biteiȝten god boþe lif and soule &punctelev; fel and flesch and bon
Fo&rrot;th he wende wel d&rrot;eo&rrot;iliche &punctelev; bote ase he nede mo&slong;te it do
And riȝt ase he cam to þe ȝate &punctelev; þe p&rrot;io&rrot; cam also
Aȝein him with p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; to loke hou it were
Anon so he hadde þe ȝate onloke &punctelev; þene kniȝt heo founden þere
Þare was Io&ydot;e and blisse inovȝ &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; togadere come
With song and oþur melodie &punctelev; þane kn&ydot;ȝt þareout hu&ydot; nome
Ant ladden him fo&rrot;th to churche anon &punctelev; ant þonkeden god wel fa&slong;te
Þis kniȝt bifo&rrot;e þe heiȝe auctere &punctelev; aknes wel sone him ca&slong;te
Ant &slong;tableliche in his o&rrot;esones &punctelev; fiftene dawes he la&ydot;
And þonkede o&rrot;e louerd & on him cride &punctelev; boþe n&ydot;ȝt and da&ydot;
And sethþe on his bare flesch &punctelev; þe holie croiz he nam
And wende to þe holie lond &punctelev; ant su&ydot;þe holi man bicam
he ne tolde neuereeft nouȝt of þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; bote ase he were euere in þouȝte
Ake wende euere fo&rrot;th wel &slong;tilleliche[al. simpleliche] &punctelev; as he of noþing ne rouȝte
Ofte he tolde of alle þe men &punctelev; þat in para&ydot;s were
As him þouȝte, greiȝe Monekes &punctelev; me&slong;t Io&ydot;e hadden þere
Nonemanere men in so gret Io&ydot;e &punctelev; ne in so grete honour he ne seiȝ
hit nis no wonder sikerliche &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e is noble and heiȝ.
Novþe ȝe habbez alle iheo&rrot;d &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace
hou seint paterik þulke purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; founde in þat place
Fo&rrot;to warni men aboute &punctelev; heo&rrot;e sunnes here to bete
Fo&rrot; þe loue of Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and of is moder swete
Alle ower sunnes betez here &punctelev; as god ov wole grace sende
Þat ȝe mouwen withoute pine &punctelev; to para&ydot;s hennes wende
god leue us ovre sunnes here so biete &punctelev; fo&rrot; is holie wounde
Þat we ne þo&rrot;uen in purgato&rrot;ie &punctelev; bileue bote lu&ydot;te &slong;tounde
